title: Putin tells Venezuela's Maduro no direct action needed on oil prices
content:
MOSCOW, Sept 3 (Reuters) - Russian President Vladimir Putin
told his Venezuelan counterpart  Nicolas Maduro that both
countries should combine efforts to prop up falling world oil
prices but did not say how, Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov said
on Thursday. 
    
Peskov said Putin poured cold water on potential "direct"
actions, possibly implying production cuts, to support the price
of oil, Russia's main commodity export.

 (Reporting by Maria Tsvetkova; Writing by Vladimir Soldatkin;
Editing by Andrew Osborn)
